intro: Anemone obtusiloba var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smoothleaf anemone, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces showy, white to pale pink flowers with five to seven petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
